intro: Coccanthera hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's coccanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat.
